resources.string: Applying for a Class D License
Specific groups and special health concerns

All people in Massachusetts, regardless of immigration status, have access to some sort of healthcare. For more information on the different forms of healthcare and what forms you are eligible for, see below:

Public charge is the law that prevents people who are likely to become a government expense from becoming citizens of the United States. The expenses which fall under public charge are cash assistance for income maintenance (such as SSI and TANF) and institutionalization for long term care. If it is determined that an non-citizen either constitutes a public charge or is likely to do so, they will lose their eligibility to become a lawful citizen.

The MBTA (Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority) is the association which is responsible for a collection of public transportation services which are offered in the Massachusetts area. The services are broken down based on the type of transportation provided, the region which it is available for, fees, accessibility, etc. Select a button below for more information:
Transportation systems in the Greater Boston Area:

The subway, or occasionally simply referred to as the “T” is a group of underground trains which travel specifically within the greater Boston area. The T is composed of 4 major lines: Red, Orange, Green, and Blue, but all of these lines do connect to each other, allowing for travel across all parts of the area. For a general guide on using the subway, click here. For more specific information see below:
